definitions.definition: To manage to gain access to.
definitions.example: I have a lot of money in my trust fund. I just can't get at it.

definitions.definition: To understand or ascertain by investigation.
definitions.example: We need to get at the root cause of all this.
I don't understand. What are you getting at?

definitions.definition: To attack verbally or physically; to annoy, bother.
definitions.example: He's a bit disheartened. The newspapers have been getting at him again.

definitions.definition: To persuade by intimidation, to tamper with.
definitions.example: That was a ridiculous verdict. I think the jury was got at.
I've got some things to do for about an hour. After that, get at me.
